title: Ticket #3968: Nested ads not detected properly by ClassAd caching code
description:
In the ClassAd caching code, a nested ad cannot be cached and shared across multiple enclosing ads. This is because the nested ad contains a pointer to the enclosing ad for its parent scope. This pointer needs to be set properly for attribute references to resolve properly during expression evaluation.

CachedExprEnvelope::cache() checks whether the value of an attribute is a ClassAd and doesn't cache it. But if the value contains a nested ad, it does cache it.

For example, this attribute/value pair will be cached: A=[Z=User].Z This should evaluate to the value of the User attribute in the enclosing ad, if it's defined. If caching is enabled, it always evaluates to Undefined.

The caching code needs to examine the entire expression tree to look for any occurrences of a nested ad and not cache if one is found.
